author: Special Correspondent
text: The continued under utilisation of the Salem – Namakkal – Karur sectionis a matter of concern for the commuters of not only the western districts, but also those of central and southern districts. At present only three pairs of passenger trains, including one pair of temporary service, are being operated between Salem and Karur during the whole day. There is no night time connectivity. Palani – Chennai Central and Nagercoil – Bengaluru overnight services are the only regular express trains on this section. The yet another express train Nagercoil – Kacheguda express train being run on this section is a weekly train. Various commuters associations have been regularly pleading for the introduction of more trains on this section. The Salem Railway Users Forum has pointed out that at present Salem is not directly connected to Rameswaram, Tirunelveli, Madurai, Kanyakumari and Tiruchi during the day time. The forum has demanded the extension of Salem – Karur passenger to Tiruchi; the Tiruchi – Karur passenger to Salem. The forum has also demanded the extension of Tirunelveli – Erode passenger and the Tiruchi – Erode passenger to Salem.
title: Run more trains: passengers
